challengeName: AAF HTML5 UI Prototype Challenge - Part2
detailedRequirements:
Project Overview:
Welcome to the AAF HTML5 UI Prototype Challenge – Part2! The goal of this challenge is to create a Responsive HTML5 Prototype based on provided storyboards for Appirio Application Framework using Angular JS and Bootstrap frameworks.

As part of this challenge you will need to document all HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript code. We need clear explanation of the code to help us figure all the HTML5/CSS3/JS code functions and make it easier for future developers and the client to understand what you have built.

NOTE: This application will be using AngularJS Framework (http://angularjs.org, http://docs.angularjs.org/guide) and Bootstrap 3 (http://getbootstrap.com/getting-started). Please follow coding standards and write clean code for AngularJS data binding instead of using plain HTML code.

Tips for Success: Asking questions early and getting Copilot or PM's feedback is very important for the success of this challenge.

Competition Task Overview:
The main task of this competition is to develop HTML5 prototype based on the provided storyboard designs. Your prototype must work properly in all the required browsers.

Required Pages:
Note: In the previous challenge (part1) we developed the header with header interactions and the footer, and in this part of the challenge (Part 2) we are concerned with developing application main content.

Important:
- The main goal is to maintain one HTML file for all devices and to make sure everything is consistent.
- You are provided with Part1 code so you can build on it and finish what we started.

Below are the required pages for all devices.

Desktop:
1) General Main Content:
- Clicking on “Filter” icon will view filter options (01-10_Desktop.png).
- Edit and delete options should be working.
- Show and pagination should be functional.

2) Table View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Table will take you to table view.
- Selecting a row will have an active state (01-11_Desktop.png), note the new icon options appearing in sub application header, edit and delete actions should be functional.
- Clicking on "Actions" icon will view action options (01-12_Desktop.png).
- Clicking on "Grid" icon will view the content as grid (01-13_Desktop.png).

3) Card View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Card will take you to card view; so you need to change second sub application name to Sub App-Card.
- Clicking on “List” icon will view the cards as list (01-17_Desktop.png).
- Clicking on “Grid” icon will view the cards as grid (01-14_Desktop.png).
- Hover over the card in gird view to see the options (01-15_Desktop.png).
- Select a card will have active state (01-16_Desktop.png), note we need the new icon options appearing in sub application header like in (01-11_Desktop.png).
- You will be able to rate cards as shown.

 4) Schedule View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Schedule will take you to schedule view; so you need to change third sub application
name to Sub App-Schedule.
- Clicking on “Month” icon will view the events in monthly view (01-18_Desktop.png), notice the current day will have an active state (orange square), and days with events will have green circles.
- Clicking on “Week” icon will view the evens in weekly view (01-19_Desktop.png).
- Hover over an event in weekly view to see the options (01-20_Desktop.png).
- You should be able to switch between months and weeks by using the right and left arrows.

1) General Main Content:
- Clicking on “Filter” icon will view filter options (02-10_Tablet_L.png, 03-9_Tablet_P.png).
- Edit and delete options should be working.
- Show and pagination should be functional.

2) Table View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Table will take you to table view.
- Selecting a row will have an active state (02-11_Tablet_L.png, 03-10_Tablet_P.png), note the new icon options appearing in sub application header, edit and delete actions should be functional.
- Clicking on "Actions" icon will view action options (02-12_Tablet_L.png, 03-11_Tablet_P.png).
- Clicking on "Grid" icon will view the content as grid (02-13_Tablet_L.png, 03-12_Tablet_P.png).

3) Card View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Card will take you to card view; so you need to change second sub application name to Sub App-Card.
- Clicking on “List” icon will view the cards as list (02-17_Tablet_L.png, 03-16_Tablet_P.png).
- Clicking on “Grid” icon will view the cards as grid (02-14_Tablet_L.png, 03-13_Tablet_P.png).
- Tapping over the card in gird view to see the options (02-15_Tablet_L.png, 03-14_Tablet_P.png).
- Select a card will have active state (02-16_Tablet_L.png, 03-15_Tablet_P.png), note we need the new icon options appearing in sub application header like in (02-11_Tablet_L.png).
- You will be able to rate cards as shown.

 4) Schedule View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Schedule will take you to schedule view; so you need to change third sub application name to Sub App-Schedule.
- Clicking on “Month” icon will view the events in monthly view (02-18_Tablet_L.png, 03-17_Tablet_P.png), notice the current day will have an active state (orange square), and days with events will have green circles.
- Clicking on “Week” icon will view the evens in weekly view (02-19_Tablet_L.png, 03-18_Tablet_P.png).
- Tapping over an event in weekly view to see the options (02-20_Tablet_L.png, 03-19_Tablet_P.png).
- You should be able to switch between months and weeks by using the right and left arrows.

Mobile (Landscape & Portrait):
1) General Main Content:
- Clicking on “Filter” icon will view filter options (04-10_Mobile_L.png, 05-10_Mobile_P.png).
- Edit and delete options should be working.
- Show and pagination should be functional.

2) Table View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Table will take you to table view.
- Clicking on "List" icon will view the content as list (04-15_Mobile_L.png, 05-15_Mobile_P.png).
- Clicking on "Grid" icon will view the content as grid (04-16_Mobile_L.png, 05-16_Mobile_P.png).

3) Card View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Card will take you to card view; so you need to change second sub application name to Sub App-Card.
- Selecting a row will have an active state (04-13_Mobile_L.png, 05-13_Mobile_P.png).
- Clicking on "Actions" icon will view action options (04-12_Mobile_L.png, 05-12_Mobile_P.png).
- Clicking on "Grid" icon will view the content as grid (04-14_Mobile_L.png, 05-14_Mobile_P.png).

4) Schedule View:
Note: - Clicking on "Hamburger" icon to the left of Topcoder Direct will view the sub application switcher, selecting Sub App-Schedule will take you to schedule view; so you need to change third sub application name to Sub App-Schedule.
- Clicking on “Month” icon will view the events in monthly view (04-18_Mobile_L.png, 05-18_Mobile_P.png), notice the current day will have an active state (orange square), and days with events will have green circles.

Note: Some screens are missing in mobile view, but you should be able to build them from desktop and tablet view.

Specific HTML/CSS/JavaScript Requirements:
HTML/CSS Requirements:
- Your HTML code must be valid HTML5 and follow best practices
- Validate your code - reviewers may accept minor validation errors, but please comment your reason for any validation errors. Use the validators listed in the scorecard.
- Use CSS to space out objects, not clear/transparent images (GIFs or PNGs) and use proper structural CSS to layout your page. Only use table tags for tables of data/information and not for page layout.
- No inline CSS styles - all styles must be placed in an external style-sheet.
- Use semantically correct tags - use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.
- Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)
- Label all CSS, JavaScript, or HTML hacks with explanations so others will understand.
- Your code must render properly in all browsers listed in the scorecard in both Mac and PC environments.

Font Requirements:
- Use font - Arial.

JavaScript Requirements:
- jQuery
- AngularJS
- Bootstrap 3

Browsers Requirements:
- IE 9+ Browsers on PC - (use HTML5shiv to support IE9 version)
- Latest Safari Browser on iPad, iPhone, MAC and PC
- Latest Chrome Browser on Android, MAC and PC
- Latest Firefox Browser on MAC and PC

Documentation Provided:
- Storyboard Screens and PSD files can be found in forums.
- Previous challenge UI Prototype files can be found in forums.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Submission Deliverables:
- A complete list of deliverables can be viewed in the UI Prototype Competitions Tutorial.

Final Submission:
- For each member, the final submission should be uploaded to the Online Review Tool.
